Hmm, that block number is eerily specific. It's an epoch transition block. Are you sure you're ethash verification cache didn't get corrupted by any chance? By default it's placed in your datadir under `geth/ethash`. You can safely delete these files (they should all look like `cache-RXX-...`).

Looking at your logs, there are further flags you specified but did not list here:

```
INFO [12-22|15:17:28.524] Disk storage enabled for ethash caches   dir=/media/nuc/D1/ethereum_geth_full count=3
INFO [12-22|15:17:28.524] Disk storage enabled for ethash DAGs     dir=/media/nuc/D1/ethereum_geth_full count=2
```

These point to you specifying both `--ethash.cachedir` and `--ethash.dagdir`. If you moved these folders onto a remote device and terminated geth abruptly while it was generating the caches, i could imagine something getting corrupted.
The error message btw also points to an ethash pow error, which again is consistent with something being off with your cached ethash verification cache.
cleared all cache files and problem is gone, thanks @karalabe !!!
this solution of clearing the caches, helped me too!!!
